intro: Ophiorrhiza linearifolia, commonly known as the slender leaf orchid, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, linear leaves and delicate flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest undergrowth. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported healing properties. Ophiorrhiza linearifolia plays an important ecological role in its native habitats by supporting local biodiversity.
